de.esoco.entity

Class EntityManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.entity.EntityManager

  • public class EntityManager
extends java.lang.Object
    A management class with static method to access, modify, and create entities.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  EntityManager.StoreListener
      An interface for event listeners that want to be notified if an entity has been stored.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String GLOBAL_ID_PREFIX_SEPARATOR
      The separator character for the prefix of global entity IDs.

    • Method Detail

      • addStoreListener

        public static void addStoreListener(EntityManager.StoreListener rListener)
        Adds a listener that will be notified if an entity is stored through the entity manager.
        Parameters:
        rListener - The listener to add

      • cacheEntity

        public static <E extends Entity> void cacheEntity(E rEntity)
        Stores an entity in the global entity cache for lookup by the global entity ID. This is done automatically by the methods that query entities but can also be invoked by application code to cache entities that have just been created. The given entity must have a valid ID or else an exception will be thrown. The entity will be cached with a weak reference so that it will be removed from the cache if it is no longer referenced by application code.
        Parameters:
        rEntity - The entity to cache

      • checkUnsavedEntityModifications

        public static void checkUnsavedEntityModifications(java.lang.String sContextId,
                                                   org.obrel.core.Relatable rContext)
        Checks whether all modified entities in an entity modification context have been stored. See setEntityModificationContext(String, Relatable, boolean) for details.

        This method is intended to be used internally by the framework only.

        Parameters:
        sContextId - The ID of the entity modification context to check
        rContext - The Relatable object that serves as the context

      • collectDownwards

        public static <E extends Entity> java.util.List<E> collectDownwards(java.util.List<E> rEntities,
                                                                    org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.util.List<E>> rChildAttribute,
                                                                    de.esoco.lib.expression.Predicate<? super E> rPredicate)
        Collects all entities in a hierarchy of entities that match a certain predicate by descending the entity tree at a certain child attribute.
        Parameters:
        rEntities - The list of root entities to start searching at
        rChildAttribute - The child attribute to descend the hierarchy at
        rPredicate - The predicate to evaluate the entities with
        Returns:
        A new list containing the resulting entities (may be empty but will never be NULL)

      • delete

        public static void delete(Entity rEntity)
                   throws de.esoco.storage.StorageException,
                          de.esoco.lib.manage.TransactionException
        Deletes the given Entity from the database. Children attached to this Entity are not deleted.
        Parameters:
        rEntity - The Entity to delete from the database.
        Throws:
        de.esoco.storage.StorageException - If accessing the storage fails
        de.esoco.lib.manage.TransactionException - If the deletion fails
        See Also:
        delete(Entity, boolean)

      • delete

        public static void delete(Entity rEntity,
                          boolean bDeleteChildren)
                   throws de.esoco.storage.StorageException,
                          de.esoco.lib.manage.TransactionException
        Deletes the given Entity and all of its children from the database.
        Parameters:
        rEntity - The entity to delete.
        bDeleteChildren - TRUE if all children of the given entity should be deleted as well, FALSE otherwise.
        Throws:
        de.esoco.storage.StorageException - If accessing the storage fails
        de.esoco.lib.manage.TransactionException - If the deletion fails

      • deleteAll

        public static void deleteAll(java.util.Collection<Entity> rEntities)
                      throws de.esoco.storage.StorageException,
                             de.esoco.lib.manage.TransactionException
        Deletes all given Entities from the database. This does not delete any child entities that a entity might have
        Parameters:
        rEntities - The Entities to delete from the database.
        Throws:
        de.esoco.storage.StorageException - If accessing the storage fails
        de.esoco.lib.manage.TransactionException - If the deletion fails
        See Also:
        deleteAll(Collection, boolean)

      • deleteAll

        public static <E extends Entity> void deleteAll(java.util.Collection<E> rEntities,
                                                boolean bDeleteChildren)
                                         throws de.esoco.storage.StorageException,
                                                de.esoco.lib.manage.TransactionException
        Deletes all given Entities from the database. This does also delete any child entities that a entity might have if bDeleteChildren is TRUE.
        Parameters:
        rEntities - rEntities The Entities to delete from the database.
        bDeleteChildren - TRUE if child entities of an entity should be deleted as well.
        Throws:
        de.esoco.storage.StorageException - If accessing the storage fails
        de.esoco.lib.manage.TransactionException - If the deletion fails

      • disableCaching

        @SafeVarargs
public static void disableCaching(java.lang.Class<? extends Entity>... rEntityClasses)
        Disables the caching of a certain entity type. The given entity class must be of the exact type for which the caching shall be disabled.
        Parameters:
        rEntityClasses - The entity type to disabled caching for

      • disableDeletionOf

        public static void disableDeletionOf(java.lang.Class<? extends Entity> rEntityClass)
        Prevents the deletion of entities of a certain type. After this method has been invoked it is no longer possible to invoke the method delete(Entity, boolean) for the given entity type.
        Parameters:
        rEntityClass - The type for which to disable the deletion
        See Also:
        enableDeletionOf(Class), isDeletionEnabledFor(Class)

      • enableDeletionOf

        public static void enableDeletionOf(java.lang.Class<? extends Entity> rEntityClass)
        Allows to delete entities of a certain type. This method must be invoked once before the method delete(Entity, boolean) can be invoked for the given entity type.
        Parameters:
        rEntityClass - The type for which to enable the deletion
        See Also:
        disableDeletionOf(Class), isDeletionEnabledFor(Class)

      • evaluateEntities

        public static <E extends Entity> void evaluateEntities(de.esoco.storage.QueryPredicate<E> qEntities,
                                                       de.esoco.lib.expression.Predicate<? super E> pStopCondition,
                                                       de.esoco.lib.expression.Action<? super E> fAction)
                                                throws de.esoco.storage.StorageException
        Performs an entity query and evaluates all entities that match the query predicate with a function. Optionally a predicate can be given that stops the query as soon as the predicate evaluates to FALSE.
        Parameters:
        qEntities - The query predicate for the entities to evaluate
        pStopCondition - An optional predicate that defines a stop condition by evaluating to FALSE or NULL for none
        fAction - A function to evaluate each queried entity
        Throws:
        de.esoco.storage.StorageException - If the storage access fails

      • fetchExtraAttributes

        public static void fetchExtraAttributes(java.util.Collection<? extends Entity> rEntities)
                                 throws de.esoco.storage.StorageException
        Fetches all global extra attributes for a collections of entities. This call will only perform a single storage query for all extra attributes and thus considerably speeds up the querying of extra attributes for larger sets of entities.
        Parameters:
        rEntities - The entities to fetch the extra attributes for
        Throws:
        de.esoco.storage.StorageException - If querying the extra attributes fails

      • findDownwards

        public static <E extends Entity> E findDownwards(java.util.List<E> rEntities,

        rChildAttribute - The child attribute to descend the hierarchy at

      • getEntitySyncEndpoint

        public static final java.util.Optional<de.esoco.lib.comm.Endpoint> getEntitySyncEndpoint()
        Returns the optional Endpoint of the remote entity sync service. Such a service is available if it has previously been registered through setEntitySyncService(String, String, Endpoint). Whether it is actually used can be queried with isEntitySyncServiceEnabled() and controlled with setEntitySyncServiceEnabled(boolean).
        Returns:
        An optional containing the sync service endpoint if present

      • getModifiedEntities

        public static final java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Entity> getModifiedEntities()
        Returns a mapping from global entity IDs to the corresponding entities for all entities that are currently marked as being modified by the method beginEntityModification(Entity).
        Returns:
        The mapping of the modified entities

      • getParentHierarchy

        public static <E extends Entity> java.util.List<E> getParentHierarchy(E rEntity)
        Returns the parent hierarchy of a certain entity. The returned list will contain the parent entities of the given entity starting with the topmost parent. The list will always at least contain the argument entity.
        Parameters:
        rEntity - The entity to return the parent hierarchy of
        Returns:
        The list of parent entities with the argument entity as the last element

      • init

        public static void init(java.util.Collection<java.lang.Class<? extends Entity>> rEntityClasses)
        Global entity initialization, must be invoked before any entity operations are performed. The arguments of this method must be the entity classes used by the application. From these the entity definitions will be initialized so that entity lookups by global IDs are possible.
        Parameters:
        rEntityClasses - The entity classes used by the application (can be NULL for none)

      • queryEntities

        public static <E extends Entity> java.util.List<E> queryEntities(de.esoco.storage.QueryPredicate<E> qEntities,
                                                                 int nMax)
                                                          throws de.esoco.storage.StorageException

        Returns:

      • queryEntities

        public static <E extends Entity> java.util.List<E> queryEntities(java.lang.Class<E> rEntityClass,
                                                                 de.esoco.lib.expression.Predicate<? super E> pCriteria,
                                                                 int nMax)
                                                          throws de.esoco.storage.StorageException
        Queries a list of entities that are identified by certain search criteria.
        Parameters:
        rEntityClass - The entity type to query
        pCriteria - The criteria to search the entities by or NULL for none
        nMax - The maximum number of entities to read
        Returns:
        A list of entities for the given criteria (may be empty but will never be NULL)

        de.esoco.storage.StorageException - If the storage access fails

      • queryEntities

        public static <E extends Entity> java.util.List<E> queryEntities(java.lang.Class<E> rEntityClass,
                                                                 java.util.Map<org.obrel.core.RelationType<?>,de.esoco.lib.expression.Predicate<?>> rCriteraMap,
                                                                 int nMax,
                                                                 boolean bAnd)
                                                          throws de.esoco.storage.StorageException
        Queries a list of entities that are identified by certain attribute predicates. The attribute predicates are defined in a map that associates the attributes with the corresponding predicates. This map is not type-safe and the caller must ensure that the content of the predicate mapping is valid.

        Uses the method queryEntities(Class, Predicate, int) to perform the actual query.

        Parameters:
        rEntityClass - The entity type to query
        rCriteraMap - The mapping from attribute relation types to attribute predicates
        nMax - The maximum number of entities to read
        bAnd - TRUE for an AND concatenation of the attribute predicates, FALSE for OR
        Returns:
        A list of entities for the given criteria (may be empty but will never be NULL)
        Throws:
        de.esoco.storage.StorageException - If the storage access fails

      • queryEntities

        public static <E extends Entity,T> java.util.List<E> queryEntities(java.lang.Class<E> rEntityClass,
                                                                   org.obrel.core.RelationType<T> rAttribute,
                                                                   T rValue,
                                                                   int nMax)
                                                            throws de.esoco.storage.StorageException

        rValue - The attribute value to search for
        nMax - The maximum number of entities to read
        Returns:
        A list of entities for the given criteria (may be empty but will never be NULL)
        Throws:
        de.esoco.storage.StorageException - If the storage access fails

      • queryEntitiesByExtraAttribute

        public static java.util.Collection<Entity> queryEntitiesByExtraAttribute(de.esoco.lib.expression.Predicate<? super ExtraAttribute> pExtraAttributes,
                                                                         int nMax)
                                                                  throws de.esoco.storage.StorageException
        Queries a list of entities that are associated with certain extra attributes. When creating the extra attribute predicate an application must consider that extra attributes can be owner-specific. If only global extra attributes shall be queried the predicate should include the predicate ExtraAttribute.HAS_NO_OWNER.
        Parameters:
        pExtraAttributes - The criteria to search the extra attributes by
        nMax - The maximum number of entities to read
        Returns:
        A collection of the distinct entities that have matching extra attributes (may be empty but will never be NULL)
        Throws:
        de.esoco.storage.StorageException - If the storage access fails

      • queryEntity

        public static Entity queryEntity(java.lang.String sGlobalEntityId)
                          throws de.esoco.storage.StorageException
        Queries the entity instance that is identified by a certain global entity ID from the storage associated with the corresponding entity definition. The global ID string must be in the format that is returned by the method getGlobalEntityId(Entity).
        Parameters:
        sGlobalEntityId - The global entity ID to query the entity for
        Returns:
        The entity for the given ID or NULL if none could be found
        Throws:
        de.esoco.storage.StorageException - If the storage query fails
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given entity ID is invalid
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If no entity definition has been registered for the given ID or if the query yields more than one entity

      • queryEntity

        public static <E extends Entity> E queryEntity(java.lang.Class<E> rEntityClass,
                                               long nEntityId)
                                        throws de.esoco.storage.StorageException
        Queries an entity that is identified by a certain entity ID. This method will first check the global entity cache for an existing entity with the given ID. If no entity can be found in the cache it will be queried from the storage associated with the given entity definition and then put into the cache for later queries.
        Parameters:
        rEntityClass - The entity type to query
        nEntityId - The global entity ID to query the entity for
        Returns:
        The entity for the given ID or NULL if none could be found
        Throws:
        de.esoco.storage.StorageException - If the storage access fails
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the query yields more than one entity

      • queryEntity

        public static <E extends Entity> E queryEntity(java.lang.Class<E> rEntityClass,
                                               de.esoco.lib.expression.Predicate<? super E> pCriteria,
                                               boolean bFailOnMultiple)
                                        throws de.esoco.storage.StorageException
        Queries an entity that is identified by certain search criteria. The boolean parameters controls whether additional entities that are found for the given criteria will be ignored or will cause an error. If the parameter is TRUE and the storage query yields more than one entity an IllegalStateException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        rEntityClass - The entity type to query
        pCriteria - The criteria to search by
        bFailOnMultiple - If TRUE the call fails if multiple entities are found for the given criteria
        Returns:
        The entity for the given criteria or NULL if none could be found
        Throws:
        de.esoco.storage.StorageException - If the storage access fails
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the boolean parameter is TRUE and the query yields more than one entity

      • queryEntity

        public static <T,E extends Entity> E queryEntity(java.lang.Class<E> rEntityClass,
                                                 org.obrel.core.RelationType<T> rAttribute,
                                                 T rValue,
                                                 boolean bFailOnMultiple)
                                          throws de.esoco.storage.StorageException

        bFailOnMultiple - If TRUE the call fails if multiple entities are found for the given criteria
        Returns:

        Throws:
        de.esoco.storage.StorageException - If the storage access fails
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the boolean parameter is TRUE and the query yields more than one entity

      • queryEntity

        public static <T,E extends Entity> E queryEntity(java.lang.Class<E> rEntityClass,
                                                 java.util.Map<org.obrel.core.RelationType<?>,de.esoco.lib.expression.Predicate<?>> rCriteraMap,
                                                 boolean bAnd,
                                                 boolean bFailOnMultiple)
                                          throws de.esoco.storage.StorageException
        Queries an entity that is identified by certain attribute criteria. Uses the method queryEntity(Class, Predicate, boolean) to perform the actual query.
        Parameters:
        rEntityClass - The entity type to query
        rCriteraMap - The mapping from attribute relation types to attribute predicates
        bAnd - TRUE for an AND catenation of the attribute predicates, FALSE for OR

      • queryEntityByExtraAttribute

        public static <T> Entity queryEntityByExtraAttribute(org.obrel.core.RelationType<T> rExtraAttributeKey,
                                                     T rExtraAttributeValue,
                                                     boolean bFailOnMultiple)
                                              throws de.esoco.storage.StorageException

      • queryEntityByExtraAttribute

        public static <E extends Entity,T> E queryEntityByExtraAttribute(java.lang.Class<E> rEntityClass,
                                                                 org.obrel.core.RelationType<T> rExtraAttributeKey,
                                                                 T rExtraAttributeValue,
                                                                 boolean bFailOnMultiple)
                                                          throws de.esoco.storage.StorageException
        Queries an entity of a certain type that has an extra attribute with a particular value. This is a convenience method that returns the first entity that is returned by the method queryEntitiesByExtraAttribute(Class, RelationType, Object, int) or NULL if no matching entity could be found. The boolean parameter indicates whether the existence of multiple entities should be considered as an inconsistency and therefore result in an exception being thrown. This parameter should in most cases be set to TRUE.
        Parameters:
        rEntityClass - The class of the entity to query
        rExtraAttributeKey - The extra attribute key to search for
        rExtraAttributeValue - The value of the extra attribute with the given key
        bFailOnMultiple - If TRUE the call fails if multiple entities are found for the given criteria
        Returns:
        The entity that has the given extra attribute or NULL for none
        Throws:
        de.esoco.storage.StorageException - If the storage access fails
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the boolean parameter is TRUE and the query yields more than one entity

        Removes the lock rule for a certain entity modification context. The removed rule is returned so that the caller could concatenate it into a new rule and set the combined rule again if necessary.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The removed rule or NULL for none

      • resetEntity

        public static void resetEntity(Entity rEntity)
                        throws de.esoco.storage.StorageException
        Resets an entity to it's current persistent state. This will set all attributes and references of the given entity to their persistent values and all other relations to their default values.
        Parameters:
        rEntity - The entity to reset
        Throws:
        de.esoco.storage.StorageException - If retrieving the persistent entity state fails

      • resetEntityModifications

        public static void resetEntityModifications(org.obrel.core.Relatable rContext)
        Resets all updated entities in an entity modification context to their persistent state by invoking resetEntity(Entity).

        This method is intended to be used internally by the framework only.

        Parameters:
        rContext - The Relatable object that serves as the context

      • setAutomaticChangeLogging

        public static final void setAutomaticChangeLogging(boolean bEnabled)
        Sets the state of the automatic history logging of entity changes. If enabled storing a modified entity with storeEntity(Entity, Entity) will create a history record that contains information about the change. The default value is TRUE and it should only be set to FALSE for special purposes like bulk insertions.
        Parameters:
        bEnabled - The new state of the automatic change history logging

      • setCacheCapacity

        public static void setCacheCapacity(int nFirstLevel,
                                    int nSecondLevel,
                                    int nThirdLevel)
        Sets the capacity of the different levels of the entity cache. A value of zero disables the respective cache level. Typically a level with a higher number should be set to a higher capacity as a lower level because the higher levels can be more easily be reclaimed by the VM. The first level is permanent, entities in that level will never be removed automatically.
        Parameters:
        nFirstLevel - The capacity of the permanent cache level
        nSecondLevel - The capacity of the softly referenced cache level
        nThirdLevel - nSecondLevel The capacity of the weakly referenced cache level

      • setEntityModificationContext

        public static void setEntityModificationContext(java.lang.String sContextId,
                                                org.obrel.core.Relatable rContext,
                                                boolean bKeepExisting)
        Sets the entity modification context for the current thread. This context will then be used to prevent concurrent modifications of entities. It must be an instance of Relatable so that relations for the modification tracking can be added to it. After the entity modifications have been performed the method removeEntityModificationContext(String, boolean) must be invoked.

        This method is intended to be used internally by the framework only.

        Parameters:
        sContextId - A unique ID of the entity modification context
        rContext - A relatable object that serves as the context
        bKeepExisting - TRUE to keep an existing modification context or FALSE to throw a ConcurrentModificationException if a context has already been set for the current thread.

      • setEntityModificationLock

        public static void setEntityModificationLock(java.lang.String sContextId,
                                             de.esoco.lib.expression.Predicate<? super Entity> pRule)
        Defines a rule for entities that must not be modified by other modification contexts but the current one. The rule is a predicate that must evaluate to TRUE for entities that should be locked against modification by other contexts. The context ID must be the same as in the method setEntityModificationContext(String, Relatable, boolean).

        All registered modification lock rules will be evaluated by the method beginEntityModification(Entity). If the rule evaluates to TRUE for a certain entity in another context than that which registered the rule a ConcurrentEntityModificationException will be thrown to signal that the entity is not available for modification by the respective context.

        When the context has finished processing the locked entities it must invoke removeEntityModificationLock(String) to clear the modification rule.

        Parameters:
        sContextId - the ID of the entity modification context
        pRule - The new locked entity rule

      • setEntityModificationTracking

        public static void setEntityModificationTracking(boolean bEnabled)
        Enables or disables the automatic entity modification tracking.
        Parameters:
        bEnabled - The new modification tracking state

      • setEntitySyncService

        public static void setEntitySyncService(java.lang.String sSyncClientId,
                                        java.lang.String sSyncContext,
                                        de.esoco.lib.comm.Endpoint rSyncEndpoint)
        Sets the endpoint of an entity sync service to be used for entity lock synchronization. The context should be derived from the current application's execution context, e.g. something like production, test, or development. The usage of the service will be enabled by default which can be queried with isEntitySyncServiceEnabled() and controlled with setEntitySyncServiceEnabled(boolean).
        Parameters:
        sSyncClientId - A unique identifier of the sync service client
        sSyncContext - The application context to sync entities in
        rSyncEndpoint - The entity sync service endpoint (may be NULL to deactivate)

      • setEntitySyncServiceEnabled

        public static void setEntitySyncServiceEnabled(boolean bEnabled)
        Enables or disables the usage of the remote entity sync service for entity locking.
        Parameters:
        bEnabled - TRUE to enabled usage of the entity sync service

        Parameters:

        See Also:

      • storeEntity

        public static void storeEntity(Entity rEntity,
                               Entity rChangeOrigin)
                        throws de.esoco.lib.manage.TransactionException
        Stores an entity without a history group.
        Throws:
        de.esoco.lib.manage.TransactionException
        See Also:
        storeEntity(Entity, Entity, boolean)

      • storeEntity

        public static void storeEntity(Entity rEntity,
                               Entity rChangeOrigin,
                               boolean bHistoryGroup)
                        throws de.esoco.lib.manage.TransactionException
        Stores a single entity in the storage that is associated with the entity's class. The entity and associated history entries will be stored inside a transaction that is created with TransactionManager. Therefore, if another transaction is already active for the current thread the entity transaction will be added to it and only be committed when the surrounding transaction is.

        If the flag StorageRelationTypes.PERSISTENT is set on the entity the modification of the entity will automatically be recorded in the history. This default behavior can be disabled by setting the corresponding flag with setAutomaticChangeLogging(boolean) to FALSE.

        If the entity refers to a list of dependent entities in a relation of type EntityRelationTypes.DEPENDENT_STORE_ENTITIES all contained entities will also be stored by this method in the order in which they appear in the list after the argument entity and inside the same transaction.

        Parameters:
        rEntity - The entity to store
        rChangeOrigin - The entity to be stored as the history origin
        bHistoryGroup - TRUE to record the the entity change inside a history group
        Throws:
        de.esoco.lib.manage.TransactionException - If the entity storage transaction fails

      • stream

        public static <E extends Entity> java.util.stream.Stream<E> stream(de.esoco.storage.QueryPredicate<E> qEntities)
        Returns a stream of entities for a certain query. Important: the returned stream MUST be closed after use or else a resource leak will occur. It is recommended to use it as the argument of a try-with-resource block to ensure the stream is closed correctly.
        Parameters:
        qEntities - The entity query
        Returns:
        A stream of entities
